perturbation.original_text:
Either party may terminate the Term upon not less
than sixty (60) days prior written notice to the other party of any breach
hereof by such other party. In addition, either party may terminate the Term
immediately upon written notice in the event that the other party shall fail
to do business in the normal course or become subject to any bankruptcy,
assignment for creditors, corporate dissolution or similar proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party may terminate the Term upon not less
than fifteen (15) days prior written notice to the other party of any breach
hereof by such other party. In addition, either party may terminate the Term
immediately upon written notice in the event that the other party shall fail
to do business in the normal course or become subject to any bankruptcy,
assignment for creditors, corporate dissolution or similar proceeding.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for contract termination due to a breach to 15 days may contradict California law, which sometimes requires longer periods for reasonable notice, particularly if the breach is curable. 60 days is the more conservative period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California contract law regarding reasonable notice for termination.

perturbation.original_text:
During the Term, and for a period of five (5) years
thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party. Each party shall take, at a
minimum, measures consistent with those taken to protect its own similar types
of Confidential Information (and in any event, at least reasonable measures) to
protect the other's Confidential Information against disclosures prohibited by
this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
During the Term, and for a period of one (1) year
thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party. Each party shall take, at a
minimum, measures consistent with industry practices to protect its own similar types
of Confidential Information (and in any event, industry-standard measures) to
protect the other's Confidential Information against disclosures prohibited by
this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the confidentiality period from five years to one year and weakening the standard of care for protecting confidential information could be deemed unreasonable and insufficient under California trade secret law, especially considering the nature of the co-branding agreement and the potentially sensitive information shared.

perturbation.original_text:
In the event of termination or expiration
of this Agreement for other than a material breach of this Agreement by
Sponsor, upon notice from Sponsor delivered to Snap at least forty-five (45)
days prior to such expiration or termination, Snap shall negotiate in good
faith an agreement providing Sponsor with sponsorship rights similar to those
described herein on terms and conditions to be mutually agreed upon by the
parties. In the event that an agreement
between the parties is not executed within thirty (30) days following
delivery, of such notice to Snap, Snap shall be free thereafter to enter into
an such an agreement with any third party.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event of termination or expiration
of this Agreement for other than a material breach of this Agreement by
Sponsor, upon notice from Sponsor delivered to Snap at least fifteen (15)
days prior to such expiration or termination, Snap shall negotiate in good
faith an agreement providing Sponsor with sponsorship rights similar to those
described herein on terms and conditions to be mutually agreed upon by the
parties. In the event that an agreement
between the parties is not executed within ten (10) days following
delivery, of such notice to Snap, Snap shall be free thereafter to enter into
an such an agreement with any third party.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice and negotiation periods for the right of first refusal to 15 and 10 days respectively might be considered unreasonably short, especially in complex business relationships. Good faith negotiation typically requires a more substantial period to allow for due diligence and meaningful discussion. Such a short timeframe could be seen as a breach of the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California contract law.
